There will be various reasons:
1) People will be thinking more environmentally in respect of carbon emissions from livestock and the amount of water required to sustain produce that will be available for consumption.
2) People will be changing their mindset from an ethical perspective, realising that the treatment and production of animals for meat is not ethical and will be taking steps towards reducing their consumption knowing that they are not quite ready for a vegetarian only diet.
3) People are becoming more aware of the food and methods in which farmed animals are fed and are aware that consuming these animals is detrimental to their own health.
4) People are aware that a diet high in processed meat and cured meats is unhealthy and can lead to various illnesses later in life if consumed in high quantities.
5) People are unhappy with the way in which meat products are produced and do not know where they are sourced, how they are treated and what products are added to them.
